article:

*Arecales *Commelinales *Poales *Zingiberales *unplaced family Dasypogonaceae }}

In plant taxonomy, 'commelinids' (plural, not capitalised) is a name used by
the APG III system for a clade within the monocots, which in its turn is a
clade within the angiosperms. The commelinids are the only clade that the APG
has informally named within the monocots. The remaining monocots are a
paraphyletic unit.

Members of the commelinid clade have cell walls containing UV-fluorescent
ferulic acid.
